title: Newar language
summary: Newar (English: /niːˈwɑːr/),[3] known officially in Nepal as Nepal Bhasa,[4] is a Sino-Tibetan language spoken by the Newar people, the indigenous inhabitants of Nepal Mandala, which consists of the Kathmandu Valley and surrounding regions in Nepal. Referring to the language as Newari may be seen as derogatory.[5]
